item.description:
Let's go out and have a good time at the Revere Beach Sand Sculpting Festival.

We will meet at the Wonderland MBTA station, this is a good option for parking and the festival is only a short walk down Ocean Blvd.

A little bit about the festival:

Revere Beach has a broad sidewalk reminiscent of an old-fashioned boardwalk. During the sand-sculpting event, a small fence is set up parallel to the sea wall. Visitors stroll along a walkway in the sand and observe the art works displayed in a temporary gallery. Artists are usually sponsored by local businesses, with familiar Boston landmarks often being the theme for the festival.

The Schedule for the day is as follows:

8:00 am - 4:00 pm
Master Sculptor Competition

Afternoon
Judging of Children & Family Division and Prizes Awarded
6:30 pm - 8:30 pm
Live Entertainment
8:30 pm
Competition Winner Announced
9:00 pm
Fireworks Display

We will meet, walk around the festival, grab something to eat, listen to music and watch the fireworks. 

 

So grab your camera, your sunscreen and your blanket or chair for watching the fireworks.

Keep in mind, rain will cancel this event.

If you are running late or get lost, please remember to call the Meetup Cell phone  at

978-304-2811

 

Hope to see you at the beach

Donna & Janet
item.how_to_find_us: At the Entrance of Wonderland MBTA Station
item.why: It is amazing to see what can be done with a beachful of sand
item.name: Revere Beach Sand Sculpting Festival
